com.jaspersoft.android.sdk.network

Class InputControlRestApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jaspersoft.android.sdk.network.InputControlRestApi

  • public class InputControlRestApi
extends java.lang.Object
    Following module responsible for requesting metadata related to input controls and their states. The one allows to load initial states and validate states via POST API. 
     

   Server server = Server.builder()
       .withBaseUrl("http://mobiledemo2.jaspersoft.com/jasperserver-pro/")
       .build();

   Credentials credentials = SpringCredentials.builder()
       .withPassword("phoneuser")
       .withUsername("phoneuser")
       .withOrganization("organization_1")
       .build();


   AuthorizedClient client = server.newClient(credentials)
       .create();
   InputControlRestApi inputControlRestApi = client.inputControlApi();


   boolean freshData = true;
   String reportUri = "/report/uri";
   try {
       List<InputControlState> states = inputControlRestApi.requestInputControlsInitialStates(reportUri, freshData);

       Set<String> controlIds = Collections.singleton("control_id");
       boolean excludeState = true;
       List<InputControl> controls = inputControlRestApi.requestInputControls(reportUri, controlIds, excludeState);

       List<ReportParameter> parameters = Collections.singletonList(
       new ReportParameter("param1", Collections.singleton("value")));
       inputControlRestApi.requestInputControlsStates(reportUri, parameters, freshData);
   } catch (IOException e) {
       // handle socket issue
   } catch (HttpException e) {
       // handle network issue
   }
    Since:
    2.3

    • Method Detail

      • requestInputControls

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<InputControl> requestInputControls(@NotNull
                                                                   java.lang.String reportUri,
                                                                   @Nullable
                                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> controlIds,
                                                                   boolean excludeState)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                   HttpException
        Returns input controls for associated response. Options can be excluded by additional argument.

        ATTENTION: Exclude flag works only on JRS instances 6.0+

        Parameters:
        reportUri - uri of report
        excludeState - exclude field state which incorporates options values for control
        controlIds - ids of concrete controls
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of InputControl
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if socket was closed abruptly due to network issues
        HttpException - if rest service encountered any status code above 300

      • requestInputControlsInitialStates

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<InputControlState> requestInputControlsInitialStates(@NotNull
                                                                                     java.lang.String reportUri,
                                                                                     boolean freshData)
                                                                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                     HttpException
        Retrieves initial states of input controls associated with particular report
        Parameters:
        reportUri - uri of report
        freshData - whether data should be retrieved from cache or not
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of InputControlState
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if socket was closed abruptly due to network issues
        HttpException - if rest service encountered any status code above 300

      • requestInputControlsStates

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<InputControlState> requestInputControlsStates(@NotNull
                                                                              java.lang.String reportUri,
                                                                              @NotNull
                                                                              java.util.List<ReportParameter> parameters,
                                                                              boolean freshData)
                                                                       throws HttpException,
                                                                              java.io.IOException
        Provides values for specified controls. This API helpful to delegate cascading resolving for the server, also should handle non-cascading cases
        Parameters:
        reportUri - uri of report
        parameters - {control_id: [value, value]} associated with input controls
        freshData - whether data should be retrieved from cache or not
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of InputControlState
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if socket was closed abruptly due to network issues
        HttpException - if rest service encountered any status code above 300
